item.title: Weak Legacy 2 Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Weak Legacy 2 is a Roblox experience based on the globally renowned Demon Slayer franchise. Your goal is to master the Breathing Styles and become the best slayer on the server. However, to do so, you’ll need plenty of Yen and Rep… Instead of taking the regular grinding route to earn Yen and master your Breathing Style, you can redeem the active Weak Legacy 2 codes. By using the free Spins obtained from these codes, players may even unlock the First Swordsman Clan’s Tsugikuni buffs. Fill your inventory with free Spins, resets, and more by redeeming the codes featured below. 

Active Weak Legacy 2 Codes 

As of October 2025, the following codes are available for Roblox’s Legacy 2:

  • 25SPINSINSECTUPD  – 50 Spins (New)
  • INSECTUPDERESETRACE – Breathing Reset (New)
  • INSECTUPDRESETBREATHINGORART – Breathing Reset (New)

Inactive Weak Legacy 2 Codes 

As of October 2025, the following codes have expired for Roblox’s Legacy 2; however, it’s worth trying them again in case they become active.

  • 75SPINSSORRYFORBUGS
  • MOONUPDATERESETBREATHINGORART
  • 25SPINS50KLIKES
  • UPDATE2RESETRACE
  • 40KLIKESRESETBREATHINGORART
  • 5KLIKESRESETBREATHINGORART
  • UPD5ERESETRACE
  • 40KLIKESRESETBREATHINGORART
  • 1MVISITS50SPINS
  • 1KLIKES25AURASPINS
  • 50SPINSHALLOWEENEVENT

How to Redeem Weak Legacy 2 Codes 

Follow these steps to activate all the codes in Weak Legacy 2: 

  • Launch Weak Legacy 2 and head into the server. 
  • Hit “M” or click the “MENU” button to open the codes box. 
  • Enter the code into the “ENTER YOUR CODE” box. 
  • Press the “Redeem” button to activate your code.

What do the Weak Legacy 2 Codes offer?

The following buffs are added to your character after obtaining the Tsugikuni Clan:

  • +25 Strength
  •  +400 Durability
  • +6 Speed
  • ×0.8 XP
  • 10% Damage Reduction
  • Access to Sun and Moon Breathing

Here are all the Clan variants with their corresponding Spin chances:

  • First Swordsman – 0.1%
  • Mythic – 0.5%
  • Legendary – 1%
  • Rare – 15%
  • Uncommon – 22%
  • Common – 59.9%

If you want to reset your Breathing Style without spending Robux, the free Breathing Style Resets will help. Your Breathing Style automatically resets after redeeming the code.

Where to find new Weak Legacy 2 Codes? 

The best way to stay updated with the latest Weak Legacy 2 codes is to bookmark this page. We’ll update the active codes list whenever new ones are released. You can also join the game’s official Discord server to learn about new codes and other game news. New codes are typically released during updates and special events, so keep an eye on the active codes list during those times.

FAQs on Weak Legacy 2 Codes

What are the latest active Weak Legacy 2 codes?

INSECTUPDERESETRACE, INSECTUPDRESETBREATHINGORART, and 25SPINSINSECTUPD are the latest active codes for Weak Legacy 2. 

When will the Weak Legacy 2 codes expire? 

The developers haven’t released any expiration dates for the promo codes. However, you can expect the active ones to expire during new updates. 

What codes can be redeemed for free Clan Spins? 

25SPINSINSECTUPD is the only code that can be redeemed for Clan Spins. 

Do you love the beautiful game simulators in Roblox? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can take part in some discussions.

We also have code guides for other Roblox games, such as Strika, One Touch, Blue Lock, and Goalbound.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Campaign, Multiplayer & Zombies Are Free During Battlefield 6 Launch Week
item.content:encoded:
A new announcement has revealed that Black Ops 6 is getting a free trial during Battlefield 6’s launch week.

Battlefield 6 is set to launch on October 10, 2025, and many players believe that Call of Duty might be in trouble with the latest Battlefield installment poised to become the new FPS king. It appears that Activision is not going to let Battlefield 6’s launch week go empty, as they are offering an extensive free trial of Black Ops 6 during the same time period.

Black Ops 6 Free Trial Perfectly Aligns With Battlefield 6’s Launch Week

Through a recent blog post, Activision confirmed that Black Ops 6 will be available for free for an entire week, starting October 9 at 9:00 AM PT and ending October 16 at 10:00 AM PT. During this time, players will not only be able to access the entirety of the multiplayer and zombies modes, but also explore the game’s campaign for the first time. However, ranked play will not be included in the free trial.

In terms of maps and modes and other content included, players will be able to access “40+ Multiplayer Maps, all six Zombies Maps including Directed Mode, and new  content from The Haunting like the Gravity, Rig, and Mothball Multiplayer maps, Haunted Havoc Zombies limited-time mode, and more.” Check out all the featured maps and modes in the infographic embedded below:

In other news, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7’s open beta has been extended to October 9, 2025, which is also pretty close to Battlefield 6’s launch. Additionally, the game doesn’t include wall runs as the timeline doesn’t allow it. What are your thoughts on Black Ops 6 being free during Battlefield 6’s launch week? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about a US patent expert stating that “Nintendo is so wrong it hurts” about mods not counting as prior art. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Nintendo is “So Wrong It Hurts” About Mods Not Counting as Prior Art, Says Patent Expert
item.content:encoded:
During a new interview, a US patent expert stated that Nintendo is incorrect in its assertion that mods do not count as prior art.

For those unfamiliar, Nintendo and Pocketpair have been engaged in a patent infringement lawsuit for some time now, with the former claiming that the latter has infringed multiple patents with Palworld. Now, a US Patent expert has provided their opinion on the ongoing lawsuit and also on mods not being considered as prior art.

Nintendo Saying Mods Not Counting is Prior Art “Is the Most Asinine Thing I Have Seen”

Spotted by GamesRadar+, during a new interview with The Junglist, Kirk Sigmon, an attorney from Banner Witcoff, and an expert in patent law, spoke about Nintendo’s defense on mods not counting as prior art. Sigmon started off by stating that “Nintendo is so wrong it hurts”. Sigmon added that there might be some nuance in Japanese law that could dictate where Nintendo is coming from; however, for the world of prior art, it doesn’t have to be perfect, nor does it have to be functional either.

Sigmon then went on to explain instances where prior art has been used that isn’t a computer program in the first place. He also provided an example of an IPR case from 5-7 years ago, where a Dungeons and Dragons manual was used as prior art, as it included character sheets and other details. He adds that “you don’t have to find prior art that’s of a specific nature”, it doesn’t have to be marketed either. Most of the time, the only requirement is that “it was written down somewhere” to prove that it existed.

The patent expert goes on to say, “Nintendo’s argument that mods are somehow different, to me is the most asinine thing i have seen”. For it seems like it’s coming from someone “who doesn’t understand computers at all”. According to Sigmon’s POV, mods are essential, but they are a very dangerous space at the same time. However, “if you are creating a mod for a game that has certain functionality, that’s all that matters.”

Sigmon goes on to conclude that there have been several references used in patent offices as well as litigation that were never actually made and had numerous flaws, but that doesn’t prevent them from being prior art in the United States. There might be a nuance in Japanese law that he may not be aware of. In general, Sigmon thinks Nintendo’s argument about mods not being prior art “is a loser”. It is “fixated too highly on form over function” because where to we “end that dispute, as there are multiple Unreal Engine 5, are those mods too just cause they are running on a singular engine?

In other news, a former Capcom designer has stated that Palworld “crossed a line” in relation to the ongoing lawsuit. Additionally, Nintendo has confirmed they haven’t contacted the government about generative AI. Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about not all subscribers being hit by the Xbox Game Pass price increase. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Marathon Pricing And Launch Weapons Details Leak Online
item.content:encoded:
New information on pricing and launch weapons for Bungie’s upcoming extraction shooter Marathon has been leaked online. These details from a known Destiny 2 and Marathon data miner include details on the game’s pricing, season pass, and even launch weapons.

In a series of posts on social media, Colony Deaks says that the game will launch with two editions and remain a premium-priced title.

According to their posts, Marathon’s base price will be $40—which has long been rumored–while the Deluxe Edition of the game will be “around $60”. The Deluxe Edition, they say, will include more skins for players and possibly more. There’s also a pre-order bonus that includes a Destiny ship, ghost, and sparrow, along with a weapon skin. Lastly, the Deluxe Edition will give players “around $30-ish worth of season pass tokens,” though they are unclear what the tokens will be for.

In addition to the game itself, Bungie is planning a season pass for the game that will be cosmetic only and cost “around $10”.

Plenty Of Weapons

Aside from the pricing information, details on Marathon’s launch weapons were also provided. According to Colony Deaks, the game will launch with 28 weapons.

The weapons will be broken down as follows:

AR

  • Overrun AR
  • V75 Scar
  • Impact HAR
  • M77 AR

LMG

  • Retaliator LMG
  • Demolition HMG
  • Conquest LMG

Precision Rifles

  • Hardline PR
  • Repeater PR
  • V66 Lookout
  • B33 Volley Rifle
  • Twin Tap HBR
  • Stryder M1T

Pistols

  • V11 Punch
  • CE Tactical Sidearm
  • Magnum MC

Railguns

  • V00 Zeus RG
  • Ares RG

Shotguns

  • Misriah 2442
  • V85 Circuit Breaker
  • WSTR Combat Shotgun

Sniper Rifles

  • Outland
  • V99 Channel Rifle
  • Longshot

SMG

  • Copperhead RF
  • Bully SMG
  • V22 Volt Thrower
  • BRRT

As with all rumors, even ones from usually reliable sources, please take the information with a grain of salt until it becomes official or Insider Gaming can independently confirm. Currently, Bungie is holding signups for a closed technical test of Marathon, taking place from October 22-27.

What do you think of the pricing and possible launch weapons for Marathon? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about Microsoft addressing recent rumors surrounding the future of Xbox hardware. And make sure you subscribe to the Insider Gaming Newsletter.
